name: Odaiba
tagline: Waterfront sushi bars & a Ferris wheel
description: Accessed via the Rainbow Bridge or the futuristic Yurikamome train, Odaiba is a high-tech entertainment hub on an artificial island in Tokyo Bay. Visitors head to the beach at Seaside Park, enjoy

name: Sensō-ji
tagline: Historic temple to the goddess of mercy
description: Completed in 645, this temple, Tokyo's oldest, was built to honor Kannon, the goddess of mercy.

name: Tokyo Disneyland
description: Tokyo offshoot of the iconic theme park known for its rides, live shows & costumed characters.

name: Tokyo Skytree
tagline: Huge tower with an observation deck
description: World's tallest freestanding broadcasting tower with an observation deck boasting 360-degree views.

name: Tokyo Tower
description: Reminiscent of the Eiffel Tower, this landmark features observation areas & other attractions.

name: Meiji Shrine
tagline: Famed Shinto shrine with a garden
description: Surrounded by forest, this venerable Shinto shrine features a seasonal iris garden.

name: Tokyo DisneySea
tagline: Disney theme park inspired by the sea
description: Part of the Disney resort, this large park has 7 themed ports of call with rides, shows & dining.

name: Harajuku
description: Buzzing Harajuku is renowned for its colorful street art and fashion scene, with quirky vintage clothing stores and cosplay shops along Takeshita Street, and more traditional, upmarket boutiques

name: Ueno Park
tagline: Large park with a zoo, a lake & museums
description: Popular city park featuring ample walking paths, a lake with boat rentals, a zoo & several museums.

name: Tokyo Imperial Palace
description: This site with scenic gardens & tours of the grounds is the main residence of the emperor of Japan.

name: Tokyo Disney Resort
description: The Tokyo Disney Resort is a theme park and vacation resort located in Urayasu, Chiba, Japan, just east of Tokyo. It is owned and operated by the Oriental Land Company with a license from The

name: Roppongi
description: Roppongi is a lively entertainment district where locals and tourists mix in buzzing late-night bars and clubs. By day, the vast Roppongi Hills skyscraper complex draws foot traffic for its observation

name: Shinjuku Gyo-en
tagline: Sizable park with gardens & a greenhouse
description: This former estate is now a 143-acre park with diverse garden areas, grassy expanses & a greenhouse.

name: Tsukiji fish market
tagline: Fish market with an extensive selection
description: Sprawling wholesale fish market with an array of seafood & viewing areas for a popular tuna auction.

name: Mount Takao
description:
Mount Takao is a mountain in the city of Hachiōji, Tokyo, Japan. It is protected within Meiji no Mori Takao Quasi-National Park.
Standing 599 metres tall and located within an hour of downtown

name: Yoyogi Park
tagline: Park on site of the 1964 Olympic village
description: Large, public city park with lakes, fountains & forested areas with mature trees.

name: Roppongi Hills
description: Complex housing offices, restaurants & art museum, plus a skyscraper with a roof observation deck.

name: Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building
description: Kenzo Tange-designed City Hall complex with views from the tallest building's observation decks.

name: Ghibli Museum
description: Whimsical museum dedicated to the famed animation studio with a play area, theater & rooftop garden.

name: Hamarikyu Gardens
tagline: Former Imperial gardens open to public
description: Public park with a pond, laid out in the Edo-period style, on the site of 17th-century Shogun villa.

name: Ueno Zoo
description: 19th-century zoo with 400+ animal species, including pandas, a petting area & a 5-story pagoda.

name: Kabukichō, Tokyo
description: Kabukichō is an entertainment and red-light district in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan. Kabukichō is the location of many host and hostess clubs, love hotels, shops, restaurants, and nightclubs, and

name: Rainbow Bridge
tagline: Bridge known for its colorful lights
description: This suspension bridge crossing Tokyo Bay is colorfully illuminated at night using solar power.

name: Edo Castle
description: Moats, walls & other remains of this castle built in 1457 are now part of the Tokyo Imperial Palace.

name: Sunshine City, Tokyo
description: Sunshine City is a building complex located in East Ikebukuro, Toshima, Tokyo, Japan. It is Tokyo's oldest city within the city and has the 240 metre tall Sunshine 60 skyscraper at its centre

name: Tokyo National Museum
tagline: Grand site for Japanese art & antiques
description: Stately museum complex devoted to the art & antiquities of Japan, as well as other Asian countries.

name: Kichijōji
description: Kichijōji is a neighborhood in the city of Musashino in Tokyo, Japan. It is centered on the compact but very popular commercial area to the north of its train station and to the south a little

name: Rikugi-en
description: Rikugi-en is a Tokyo metropolitan park in Bunkyō-ku. The name Rikugi-en means Garden of the Six Principles of Poetry which comes from the idea of the six elements in waka poetry while en means

name: Edo-Tokyo Museum
description: Major museum opened in 1993 & displaying artifacts from Tokyo's Edo period & one-off exhibits.

name: Inokashira Park
tagline: Urban green space with boating & a zoo
description: Established in 1917, this 95-acre city park features a pond with boating facilities, a zoo & trails.

name: Tokyo Dome
description: This iconic domed stadium hosts baseball games & other sporting events, plus concerts & exhibitions.

name: Takeshita Street
description: Takeshita Street is a pedestrian shopping street lined with fashion boutiques, cafes and restaurants in Harajuku in Tokyo, Japan. Stores on Takeshita Street include major chains such as The Body

name: Yasukuni Shrine
tagline: Shrine dedicated to those killed in war
description: Shinto-style shrine commemorating Japanese war dead with a military history museum on its grounds.

name: Ameya-Yokochō
description: Popular indoor-outdoor market with many shops selling everything from food & gifts to apparel.

name: Sanrio Puroland
description:
Sanrio Puroland is an indoor theme park located in Tama New Town, Tokyo, Japan that attracts over 1.5 million visitors per year.
Opened on December 7, 1990, the theme park is run by the Sanrio

name: Miraikan
description: Hands-on exhibits & classes exploring the future of science & technology, plus a cafe & a gift shop.

name: Hachijō-jima
description: Hachijō-jima is a volcanic Japanese island in the Philippine Sea. It is about 287 kilometres south of the special wards of Tokyo, to which it belongs. It is part of the Izu archipelago and within

name: Mount Mitake
tagline: Mountain, autumn leaf color, and hiking
description: Mount Mitake is a mountain in the Chichibu Tama Kai National Park near Tokyo, Japan. It stands 929 m tall. On the mountain is a Shinto shrine where practices such as Futomaki divination take

name: Joypolis
description: Indoor amusement park featuring a roller coaster, arcade games & virtual-reality experiences.

name: Koishikawa-Kōrakuen
description: Tranquil, scenic landscape garden dating to the 17th century, with walking paths, a pond & bridges.

name: Shinjuku Golden Gai
description: Festive, popular city district famed for its narrow, winding alleys & numerous snug taverns.

name: Showa Memorial Park
tagline: National park with bike trails & cafes
description: Sprawling national park with extensive trails, bike paths & a variety of gardens & woods.

name: National Museum of Nature and Science
tagline: Museum with an array of science exhibits
description: Sprawling museum with a 360-degree movie theater & exhibits on topics such as dinosaurs & evolution.

name: Sumida Aquarium
description: Stylish, contemporary aquarium featuring a variety of fish & a host of penguins, plus a cafe.

name: Hanayashiki
description: Amusement park with a roller coaster & other high-speed rides, plus kids' activities & eateries.

name: Zōjō-ji
description: The main temple of Jōdo-shū Buddhism, this compound includes ornate buildings dating to the 1600s.

name: Chichijima
tagline: Dolphins, whales, scuba diving, and nature
description: Chichijima, formerly known as Peel Island and in the 19th century known to the English as part of the Bonin Islands, is the largest island in the Ogasawara archipelago. Chichi-jima is approximately

name: Mori Art Museum
tagline: Modern art museum in a skyscraper
description: Art museum in the Mori Tower featuring a rotating exhibition of international contemporary artwork.

name: Tokyo Midtown
tagline: Art museum, ice skating, shopping, and art
description: Tokyo Midtown is a 569,000-square-meter mixed-use development in Akasaka, Tokyo, Japan. Completed in March 2007, the $3 billion project includes office, residential, commercial, hotel, and leisure
